00012 class RobotFactory(object):
00013     def build(self):
00014         """Builds a robot object.
00015 
00016         Returns: Robot. A robot object.
00017         """
00018         # Navigation
00019         move_base_client = actionlib.SimpleActionClient('move_base', MoveBaseAction)
00020         tf_listener = tf.TransformListener()
00021         navigation = Navigation('base_footprint', 'map', tf_listener, move_base_client)
00022 
00023         # Interface
00024         interface_publisher = rospy.Publisher('rapid_robot/interface/interface_params',
00025                              InterfaceParams)
00026         interface = Interface(interface_publisher)
00027 
00028         # Location DB
00029 
00030         robot = Robot(interface, navigation, tf_listener)
00031         return robot
00032 
00033 class Robot(object):
00034     def __init__(self, interface, navigation, tf_listener):
00035         self.interface = interface
00036         self.navigation = navigation
00037         self._tf_listener = tf_listener
00038 
00039     def location_db(self, db_filename):
00040         """Returns a location database.
00041 
00042         The location DB file can be any Python shelve file that maps strings
00043         to geometry_msgs/PoseStamped messages.
00044 
00045         Args:
00046           db_filename: string. The location on the filesystem of DB file.
00047 
00048         Returns: LocationDb.
00049         """
00050         return LocationDb(db_filename, self._tf_listener)
00051 
00052     @staticmethod
00053     def wait_for_event(function, timeout):
00054         """Calls the given function, but bounds the time by the given timeout.
00055     
00056         The function will be called with no arguments. If it returns before the
00057         timeout, then this function will return event_complete=True and the result
00058         of the function. Otherwise, this function will return (False, None).
00059 
00060         Args:
00061           function: function. A no-argument function to call.
00062           timeout: float. The time, in seconds, to wait for the function to return.
00063         """
00064         import signal
00065     
00066         class TimeoutError(Exception):
00067             pass
00068     
00069         def handler(signum, frame):
00070             raise TimeoutError()
00071     
00072         signal.signal(signal.SIGALRM, handler)
00073         signal.alarm(timeout)
00074         event_complete = False
00075         result = None
00076         try:
00077             result = function()
00078             event_complete = True
00079         except TimeoutError as exc:
00080             event_complete = False
00081             result = None
00082         finally:
00083             signal.alarm(0)
00084     
00085         return event_complete, result
